meanings.definition: counterculturalisms - the beliefs or practices of a counterculture
meanings.sent1: Many young people today are exploring counterculturalisms by embracing unconventional lifestyles.
meanings.sent2: The counterculturalisms of the 1960s challenged societal norms and values.
meanings.sent3: The professor found it amusing how counterculturalisms often lead to new artistic movements.
meanings.sent4: In a world of conformity, counterculturalisms stand out like vibrant flowers in a field of grass.
meanings.sent5: The counterculturalisms of the past continue to inspire rebellion and creativity today.

meanings.definition: counterculturalisms - the state of being countercultural
meanings.sent1: The counterculturalisms of the 1970s were characterized by a rejection of mainstream ideals.
meanings.sent2: She embraced counterculturalisms by living off the grid and growing her own food.
meanings.sent3: It's interesting how counterculturalisms can influence mainstream culture over time.
meanings.sent4: His counterculturalisms were like a beacon of individuality in a sea of conformity.
meanings.sent5: The counterculturalisms of the past remind us of the power of nonconformity.
